item.title: Workshop with Track management team @SBB!
item.description: Today, we had a productive workshop with the SBB track management team. We introduced our methodology to estimate intervention requirements, their costs, and required possession windows in the early phases of the intervention planning process. The workshop was well-received and we had a very good discussion afterwards. We exchanged feedback and ideas on how to improve and adapt this work to the specific needs and challenges of the SBB network. I am looking forward to working more closely with the SBB team to find the best ways to implement this work and support their decision making in the intervention planning process.

item.title: Spring semester 2024
item.description: I am excited to announce that I will be involved in mentoring six students in the FS2024 semester. Two of them are Master’s projects that focus on the failure risks analysis of the road infrastructure, and four of them are Bachelor’s theses that aim to estimate the financial needs to manage SZU infrastructures. These are very important topics in infrastructure management, and I am eager to work with these students and help them achieve their goals.
